issuetype.description: A problem which impairs or prevents the functions of the product.
issuetype.name: Bug

status.description: This issue has been validated/reproduced, but has not been prioritized yet.
status.name: Confirmed

fields.description:
After attempting to launch a bfebs instance which failed (intentionally as part of another test I was running) I noticed that the NAT rule for that failed instance was not removed from the CC. This is causing instance(s) who get assigned that IP in another cluster to fail to become reachable. 


Instance i-367D4527 was the original failed bfebs instance run in PARTI01, which was using CC 51.95 at the time. This instance was assigned '192.168.40.122' as it's public IP before I manually terminated the instance. 

Later instance i-367D4527 now running and assigned '192.168.40.122' is unreachable as arp is still resolving to the previous CC. iptables NAT rules shown below...

{code}
----------------------------------------------------
The two instances using/used ip addr '192.168.40.122'
----------------------------------------------------

# euca-describe-instances i-367D4527 i-39A2432E
RESERVATION	r-A35140E7	161757853606	EbsTestGroup
INSTANCE	i-39A2432E	emi-FE1F3583	192.168.40.122	10.210.166.88	running	ebs_test_key-1360630250.26	0		c1.medium	2013-02-15T21:16:12.927Z	PARTI00	eki-A4003E4D	eri-2B393BF8		monitoring-disabled	192.168.40.122	10.210.166.88			instance-store			

RESERVATION	r-3CC93DF2	161757853606
INSTANCE	i-367D4527	emi-A9103DC9	10.210.166.89	10.210.166.89	terminated	ebs_test_key-1360630250.26	0		c1.medium	2013-02-15T20:42:04.666Z	PARTI01	eki-A4003E4D			monitoring-disabled	10.210.166.89	10.210.166.89			ebs				
[root@eucahost-51-69 ~]# 

----------------------------------------------------
iptables nat rules from CC in PARTI00
----------------------------------------------------

[root@eucahost-51-73 ~]# iptables -t nat -L | grep 'Chain\|target\|122'
Chain PREROUTING (policy ACCEPT)
target     prot opt source               destination         
DNAT       all  --  anywhere             eucahost-40-122.eucalyptus to:10.210.166.88 
Chain POSTROUTING (policy ACCEPT)
target     prot opt source               destination         
SNAT       all  --  10.210.166.88        anywhere            to:192.168.40.122 
Chain OUTPUT (policy ACCEPT)
target     prot opt source               destination         
DNAT       all  --  anywhere             eucahost-40-122.eucalyptus to:10.210.166.88 

----------------------------------------------------
iptables nat rules from CC in PARTI01
----------------------------------------------------
[root@eucahost-51-95 ~]# iptables -t nat -L | grep 'Chain\|target\|122'
Chain PREROUTING (policy ACCEPT)
target     prot opt source               destination         
DNAT       all  --  anywhere             eucahost-40-122.eucalyptus to:10.210.166.89 
Chain POSTROUTING (policy ACCEPT)
target     prot opt source               destination         
SNAT       all  --  10.210.166.89        anywhere            to:192.168.40.122 
Chain OUTPUT (policy ACCEPT)
target     prot opt source               destination         
DNAT       all  --  anywhere             eucahost-40-122.eucalyptus to:10.210.166.89 


----------------------------------------------------
CC list...
----------------------------------------------------

[root@eucahost-51-69 ~]# euca-describe-services | grep cluster
SERVICE	cluster        	PARTI00        	CC_72          	DISABLED  	58  	http://192.168.51.72:8774/axis2/services/EucalyptusCC	arn:euca:eucalyptus:PARTI00:cluster:CC_72/
SERVICE	cluster        	PARTI00        	CC_73          	ENABLED   	58  	http://192.168.51.73:8774/axis2/services/EucalyptusCC	arn:euca:eucalyptus:PARTI00:cluster:CC_73/
SERVICE	cluster        	PARTI01        	CC_95          	ENABLED   	58  	http://192.168.51.95:8774/axis2/services/EucalyptusCC	arn:euca:eucalyptus:PARTI01:cluster:CC_95/

comments.body: [~mclark], you are investigating this to repo, correct?
